_meta.description: Global POI index for port maps. POIs are referenced by ID in per-port manifests.

eagle-beach.name: Eagle Beach
eagle-beach.notes: Famous for bent fofoti/divi-divi trees. Consistently ranked top 3 beaches worldwide.

palm-beach.name: Palm Beach
palm-beach.notes: High-rise hotel strip with beach bars and water sports.

baby-beach.name: Baby Beach
baby-beach.notes: Protected lagoon at Aruba's southern tip. Best shore snorkeling on the island.

surfside-beach.name: Surfside Beach
surfside-beach.notes: Closest beach to cruise port - 15 minute walk.

governors-bay-beach.name: Governor's Bay Beach
governors-bay-beach.notes: Walkable from port via Wilhelmina Park bridge. Quiet cove with calm water.

arashi-beach.name: Arashi Beach
arashi-beach.notes: Northwest tip near California Lighthouse. Public palapas, uncrowded.

california-lighthouse.name: California Lighthouse
california-lighthouse.notes: Northwest tip of island. Popular sunset spot.

natural-bridge.name: Natural Bridge
natural-bridge.notes: Photogenic limestone arch, ~7 miles from port.

arikok-national-park.name: Arikok National Park
arikok-national-park.notes: Rugged landscape, popular for jeep tours.

oranjestad-downtown.name: Downtown Oranjestad
oranjestad-downtown.notes: Dutch colonial architecture, main shopping area.

renaissance-island.name: Renaissance Island
renaissance-island.notes: Private island with flamingos. Day passes available but pricey.

archaeological-museum-aruba.name: Archaeological Museum of Aruba
archaeological-museum-aruba.notes: 0.3 miles from terminals. Free admission. Collections span 2500 BC to modern day.

butterfly-farm-aruba.name: Butterfly Farm
butterfly-farm-aruba.notes: About 4 miles from port. Tropical garden with butterflies from around the world.

donkey-sanctuary-aruba.name: Donkey Sanctuary
donkey-sanctuary-aruba.notes: Six miles from port. Rescue haven where you can feed friendly donkeys.

wilhelmina-park.name: Wilhelmina Park
wilhelmina-park.notes: Near Governor's Bay Beach. Bridge access.

casibari-rock-formations.name: Casibari Rock Formations
casibari-rock-formations.notes: Unique boulder formations. Popular on taxi tours.

hooiberg.name: Hooiberg
hooiberg.notes: Aruba's famous 541-foot mountain. 561 steps to the top. On clear days you can see Venezuela.

san-nicolas.name: San Nicolas
san-nicolas.notes: Aruba's cultural capital. 80+ street art murals by local and international artists. Former oil refinery town.

alto-vista-chapel.name: Alto Vista Chapel
alto-vista-chapel.notes: Historic yellow chapel on a hill. First Catholic church site in Aruba (1750). Popular for weddings and quiet reflection.

bushiribana-gold-mill.name: Bushiribana Gold Mill Ruins
bushiribana-gold-mill.notes: Picturesque ruins of 19th-century gold smelter on north coast. Popular photo spot.

ayo-rock-formations.name: Ayo Rock Formations
ayo-rock-formations.notes: Giant diorite boulders with ancient Arawak petroglyphs. More secluded than Casibari.

baby-natural-bridge.name: Baby Natural Bridge
baby-natural-bridge.notes: Smaller but intact natural bridge near the collapsed main Natural Bridge.

malmok-beach.name: Malmok Beach
malmok-beach.notes: Popular snorkeling spot on northwest coast. Rocky entry but excellent marine life.

fishermans-huts.name: Fisherman's Huts
fishermans-huts.notes: World-class windsurfing and kiteboarding spot. Steady trade winds and shallow water.

depalm-island.name: De Palm Island
depalm-island.notes: All-inclusive island resort with waterpark, snorkel, SNUBA. Ferry from downtown. Family-friendly.

philips-animal-garden.name: Philip's Animal Garden
philips-animal-garden.notes: Exotic animal sanctuary. Interactive experience with monkeys, kangaroos, and more. Great for families.

ostrich-farm-aruba.name: Aruba Ostrich Farm
ostrich-farm-aruba.notes: Feed and interact with ostriches, emus, and other exotic birds. Educational tours.

aruba-aloe-factory.name: Aruba Aloe Factory & Museum
aruba-aloe-factory.notes: One of world's oldest aloe operations (since 1890). Free tours show production process. Gift shop.

anchorage-downtown.name: Downtown Anchorage
anchorage-downtown.notes: Walkable downtown with shops, restaurants, and museums. Drop-off point for cruise transfers.

ted-stevens-airport.name: Ted Stevens International Airport
ted-stevens-airport.notes: Major Alaska hub. Drop-off point for cruise transfers from Seward/Whittier.

alaska-wildlife-conservation-center.name: Alaska Wildlife Conservation Center
alaska-wildlife-conservation-center.notes: Top-rated sanctuary with guaranteed bear, moose, musk ox, caribou, and eagle sightings. 30 min south on Seward Highway. Viator Experience Award winner.

tony-knowles-coastal-trail.name: Tony Knowles Coastal Trail
tony-knowles-coastal-trail.notes: 11-mile paved trail from downtown along Cook Inlet. Biking, walking, wildlife viewing. Moose frequently spotted.

anchorage-museum.name: Anchorage Museum
anchorage-museum.notes: World-class exhibits on Alaska Native cultures, Arctic ecology, and northern history. Smithsonian Arctic Studies Center inside. Rooftop garden with mountain views.

alaska-native-heritage-center.name: Alaska Native Heritage Center
alaska-native-heritage-center.notes: Living history with traditional dwellings from all Alaska Native groups. Dance performances, artisan demonstrations, cultural programs.

flattop-mountain.name: Flattop Mountain
flattop-mountain.notes: Alaska's most-climbed peak. Moderate 3.5-mile round trip hike with panoramic views of Anchorage, Cook Inlet, and Denali on clear days.

lake-hood.name: Lake Hood Seaplane Base
lake-hood.notes: World's largest and busiest floatplane base. Watch takeoffs and landings. Starting point for flightseeing tours.

earthquake-park.name: Earthquake Park
earthquake-park.notes: Commemorates the devastating 1964 Good Friday Earthquake (9.2 magnitude). Interpretive signs explain the destruction. Great views of Cook Inlet.

portage-glacier.name: Portage Glacier
portage-glacier.notes: Accessible glacier 1 hour south. Boat tours to the ice face available in summer. Combine with Wildlife Conservation Center for a full day.

matanuska-glacier.name: Matanuska Glacier
matanuska-glacier.notes: Alaska's largest road-accessible glacier, 2 hours northeast. Guided ice walks explore crevasses and blue ice pools. Top-rated Viator tours.

girdwood-alyeska.name: Girdwood & Alyeska Resort
girdwood-alyeska.notes: Mountain resort town 40 min south. Summer tram rides to 2,300 ft for panoramic views. Excellent hiking. Double Musky Inn for dinner.

alaska-railroad-depot-anchorage.name: Alaska Railroad Depot
alaska-railroad-depot-anchorage.notes: Historic depot for scenic rail journeys to Seward, Whittier, Talkeetna, and Denali. GoldStar glass-domed cars recommended.

kincaid-park.name: Kincaid Park
kincaid-park.notes: 1,400-acre park with 20+ miles of trails for hiking and biking. Cross-country skiing in winter. Moose and wildlife viewing.

snow-city-cafe.name: Snow City Cafe
snow-city-cafe.notes: Legendary breakfast spot — voted best breakfast in Anchorage for years. Reindeer sausage scramble, sourdough pancakes. Expect lines.

mooses-tooth.name: Moose's Tooth Pub & Pizzeria
mooses-tooth.notes: Iconic Anchorage pizzeria. Named among America's best by Food Network. Try the Avalanche or Apricot Chicken pizza. 40+ local beers on tap.

simon-and-seaforts.name: Simon & Seafort's
simon-and-seaforts.notes: Upscale landmark since 1978. Voted best seafood in Alaska. Sweeping Cook Inlet views. King crab, crab-stuffed halibut. Reservations recommended.

humpys-alehouse.name: Humpy's Great Alaskan Alehouse
humpys-alehouse.notes: Downtown institution with halibut tacos and 50+ beers. Lively atmosphere. Good for groups.

fire-island-bakeshop.name: Fire Island Rustic Bakeshop
fire-island-bakeshop.notes: Best coffee and pastries in town. Artisan bread shipped statewide. Perfect pre-adventure fuel.

resolution-park.name: Resolution Park & Captain Cook Monument
resolution-park.notes: Downtown park with Captain Cook statue and panoramic views of Cook Inlet, Sleeping Lady (Mt. Susitna), and the Alaska Range.

ship-creek.name: Ship Creek
ship-creek.notes: Urban salmon fishing in downtown Anchorage. King salmon (June), silver salmon (August-September). Fishing licenses required.

juneau-cruise-terminal.name: Juneau Cruise Terminal
juneau-cruise-terminal.notes: Direct dock in downtown Juneau. Walk off ship into the heart of the city in under 5 minutes.

mendenhall-glacier.name: Mendenhall Glacier & Visitor Center
mendenhall-glacier.notes: Alaska's only drive-up glacier. 13 miles from downtown, 13.6 miles long. World-class visitor center with exhibits, rangers, and stunning glacier views. Top-rated Juneau attraction.

nugget-falls.name: Nugget Falls
nugget-falls.notes: Spectacular 377-foot waterfall with glacier backdrop. Easy 30-45 minute trail from Mendenhall Visitor Center. Can walk right up to the misty base.

mount-roberts-tramway.name: Mount Roberts Tramway
mount-roberts-tramway.notes: 6-minute ride to 1,800 ft for panoramic views of Juneau, Gastineau Channel, and cruise ships. Raptor center, hiking trails, Timberline Bar at top. Departs steps from cruise dock.

auke-bay-harbor.name: Auke Bay Harbor
auke-bay-harbor.notes: Departure point for most whale watching tours. 65+ migrating humpbacks frequent these waters. 30 minutes from downtown.

alaska-state-museum.name: Alaska State Museum
alaska-state-museum.notes: World-class museum of Alaska Native Tlingit culture and state history. Part of new heritage center complex. Short walk from cruise dock.

downtown-juneau.name: Downtown Juneau
downtown-juneau.notes: Walkable downtown with art galleries, jewelry shops, restaurants. Alaska's capital but no roads in or out — arrive by air or sea only.

tracys-crab-shack.name: Tracy's King Crab Shack
tracys-crab-shack.notes: Legendary Juneau institution. Fresh king crab legs, famous crab bisque, crab cakes. ~$100/lb for king crab. Expect lines but worth it. Two locations near cruise terminal.

red-dog-saloon.name: Red Dog Saloon
red-dog-saloon.notes: Historic saloon from gold rush era. Sawdust floors, live music, mounted animal heads, mining memorabilia. Famous 'duck fart' shots. Overlooking cruise docks.

hangar-on-the-wharf.name: The Hangar On The Wharf
hangar-on-the-wharf.notes: Upscale waterfront restaurant in historic seaplane hangar. Fresh Alaskan seafood, craft cocktails, harbor views. Popular with locals and cruisers.

macaulay-salmon-hatchery.name: Macaulay Salmon Hatchery
macaulay-salmon-hatchery.notes: Working hatchery with aquarium, touch tanks, and salmon ladder viewing. See thousands of returning salmon in late summer. 15-minute walk from cruise terminal.

glacier-gardens.name: Glacier Gardens Rainforest Adventure
glacier-gardens.notes: Botanical garden in Tongass National Forest with famous upside-down trees. Guided tours through temperate rainforest. Panoramic views from upper garden.

herbert-glacier.name: Herbert Glacier
herbert-glacier.notes: Destination for helicopter glacier tours and dog sledding adventures. Stunning aerial views over Juneau Icefield. Land on the ice for once-in-a-lifetime experience.

juneau-icefield.name: Juneau Icefield
juneau-icefield.notes: 1,500 square mile ice mass with 38 glaciers. Accessed by helicopter tours for glacier landings, dog sledding, and flightseeing. Visible from whale watching tours.

gold-creek-salmon-bake.name: Gold Creek Salmon Bake
gold-creek-salmon-bake.notes: All-you-can-eat fresh salmon, halibut, reindeer sausage cooked over open fires in rainforest setting. Includes gold panning, s'mores. Authentic Alaskan experience.

treadwell-mine-historic-trail.name: Treadwell Mine Historic Trail
treadwell-mine-historic-trail.notes: Historic gold mine ruins on Douglas Island across from downtown. Easy hiking through temperate rainforest with interpretive signs. Free to explore.

pelimeni.name: Pel'meni
pelimeni.notes: Tiny Russian dumpling shop famous with locals. Simple menu: pelmeni (dumplings) with various toppings. Cash only, limited seating, open late.

ketchikan-cruise-terminal.name: Ketchikan Cruise Terminal
ketchikan-cruise-terminal.notes: Walk directly off ship into downtown Ketchikan. Creek Street and shopping within 10 minutes.

downtown-ketchikan.name: Downtown Ketchikan
downtown-ketchikan.notes: Walkable downtown with jewelry shops, art galleries, and salmon-themed everything. Alaska's 'First City' — southernmost in the state.

creek-street.name: Creek Street
creek-street.notes: Historic boardwalk on stilts over Ketchikan Creek. Former red-light district, now art galleries, shops, restaurants. Most photographed spot in Ketchikan. 10-minute walk from cruise terminal.

dollys-house-museum.name: Dolly's House Museum
dollys-house-museum.notes: Historic former brothel on Creek Street, preserved as museum. Tells the colorful story of Ketchikan's rowdy past. Small admission fee.

totem-heritage-center.name: Totem Heritage Center
totem-heritage-center.notes: World's largest collection of original 19th-century totem poles. Preserves artistic traditions of Tlingit, Haida, and Tsimshian peoples. Walking distance from downtown.

totem-bight-state-park.name: Totem Bight State Historical Park
totem-bight-state-park.notes: 14 replica totem poles and reconstructed Tlingit clan house. 10 miles north of downtown. Free admission. Rainforest setting. One of best totem viewing sites in Alaska.

saxman-totem-park.name: Saxman Totem Park
saxman-totem-park.notes: Largest collection of standing totem poles in the world. Active carving shed where master carvers work. 2.5 miles south of downtown. Cultural programs and traditional dance performances available.

potlatch-park.name: Potlatch Park
potlatch-park.notes: Historic totem poles, authentic tribal house, and carving center. Some of the finest Native art in the world. North of downtown on North Tongass Highway.

misty-fjords-national-monument.name: Misty Fjords National Monument
misty-fjords-national-monument.notes: 2.3 million acres of wilderness with 3,000-ft granite cliffs, waterfalls, and remote alpine lakes. Access by floatplane (2-2.5 hours) or boat tour. Wildlife includes bears, eagles, mountain goats, whales. Most popular Ketchikan excursion.

great-alaskan-lumberjack-show.name: Great Alaskan Lumberjack Show
great-alaskan-lumberjack-show.notes: #1 rated attraction for first-time visitors. Professional lumberjacks compete in log rolling, chopping, sawing, and tree climbing. Covered/heated seating. 1 hour shows, $37 adults. At cruise harbor.

southeast-alaska-discovery-center.name: Southeast Alaska Discovery Center
southeast-alaska-discovery-center.notes: Federal visitor center with exhibits on Tongass National Forest, Alaska Native cultures, and regional ecosystems. Theater, gift shop. Near cruise terminal.

cape-fox-lodge.name: Cape Fox Lodge & Funicular
cape-fox-lodge.notes: Hilltop resort with panoramic views of Ketchikan and Tongass Narrows. Funicular ride up from Creek Street — free if dining at restaurant. Great viewpoint even without eating.

rainbird-trail-zipline.name: Rainforest Zipline Adventures
rainbird-trail-zipline.notes: Fly through rainforest canopy on multiple ziplines. Guides share ecology and history. Rain or shine — this is the rainforest capital! Various operators available.

thomas-basin-harbor.name: Thomas Basin Harbor
thomas-basin-harbor.notes: Historic fishing fleet harbor. Colorful boats, sea lions underneath docks. Alaska Fish House restaurant overlooks the basin. Great for photography.

tongass-national-forest.name: Tongass National Forest
tongass-national-forest.notes: Largest national forest in the US at 17 million acres. Temperate rainforest surrounds Ketchikan. Hiking, wildlife viewing, kayaking. Ketchikan receives 162 inches of rain annually.

alaska-fish-house.name: Alaska Fish House
alaska-fish-house.notes: Ketchikan's best seafood according to locals and visitors. Fresh fish & chips, salmon chowder, Alaskan sampler. Waterfront location at Thomas Basin. 'Best fish & chips I've ever had' — common review.

bar-harbor-restaurant.name: Bar Harbor Restaurant
bar-harbor-restaurant.notes: Upscale seafood and BBQ with harbor views. Extensive craft beer selection. Fresh seasonal menu with wine pairings. One of the few Ketchikan restaurants where you wouldn't feel out of place in a tie.

annabelles-chowderhouse.name: Annabelle's Famous Keg & Chowderhouse
annabelles-chowderhouse.notes: Historic restaurant in Gilmore Hotel building. Famous chowder, seafood, and American fare. Full bar. Consistently rated among top Ketchikan restaurants.

singapore-cruise-centre.name: Marina Bay Cruise Centre
singapore-cruise-centre.notes: Singapore's main cruise terminal for large ships. Direct MRT access. 5-10 minutes to Gardens by the Bay.

harbourfront-cruise-terminal.name: HarbourFront Cruise Centre
harbourfront-cruise-terminal.notes: Secondary cruise terminal near VivoCity mall. MRT station directly below. Gateway to Sentosa Island.

gardens-by-the-bay.name: Gardens by the Bay
gardens-by-the-bay.notes: Iconic 101-hectare nature park with Supertree Grove, Cloud Forest dome (35m indoor waterfall), and Flower Dome. Free outdoor gardens, conservatories paid. Light show nightly at 7:45pm and 8:45pm.

marina-bay-sands.name: Marina Bay Sands
marina-bay-sands.notes: Iconic triple-tower hotel with rooftop SkyPark observation deck (non-guests $32). Infinity pool hotel guests only. Shops, casino, celebrity chef restaurants below.

merlion-park.name: Merlion Park
merlion-park.notes: Singapore's iconic half-lion, half-fish statue. Best views of Marina Bay skyline. Free entry. Great photo spot day and night.

singapore-chinatown.name: Chinatown
singapore-chinatown.notes: Historic district with temples, shophouses, and street food. Buddha Tooth Relic Temple, Chinatown Heritage Centre, hawker stalls. MRT: Chinatown.

little-india-singapore.name: Little India
little-india-singapore.notes: Vibrant ethnic quarter with colorful shophouses, Hindu temples, spice markets, and authentic Indian food. Tekka Centre hawker food. MRT: Little India.

lau-pa-sat.name: Lau Pa Sat Festival Market
lau-pa-sat.notes: Historic Victorian cast-iron hawker center in CBD. Famous satay street opens evenings. Wide variety of local dishes. Walking distance from Marina Bay.

sentosa-island.name: Sentosa Island
sentosa-island.notes: Resort island with Universal Studios, S.E.A. Aquarium (world's largest), beaches, Adventure Cove waterpark. Access by monorail, cable car, or walk from HarbourFront.

singapore-zoo.name: Singapore Zoo & Night Safari
singapore-zoo.notes: World-renowned open-concept zoo with 2,800 animals. Night Safari (7:15pm-midnight) is world's first nocturnal zoo. Feed hyenas, watch tribal fire show. 30 min from downtown.

orchard-road.name: Orchard Road
orchard-road.notes: Singapore's premier shopping boulevard. ION Orchard, Takashimaya, Paragon malls. Designer boutiques to budget shopping. MRT: Orchard.

clarke-quay.name: Clarke Quay
clarke-quay.notes: Riverside entertainment district with restaurants, bars, and nightclubs. Bumboat river cruises depart here. Colorful colonial warehouse conversions. MRT: Clarke Quay.

raffles-hotel.name: Raffles Hotel
raffles-hotel.notes: Colonial-era grand hotel (1887). Birthplace of the Singapore Sling cocktail. Long Bar open to non-guests. Restored to original glory in 2019.

jumbo-seafood.name: Jumbo Seafood
jumbo-seafood.notes: Singapore's most famous chili crab restaurant. Riverside location. Expect $60-80 for two with crab. Reservations essential. Multiple locations.

maxwell-food-centre.name: Maxwell Food Centre
maxwell-food-centre.notes: Famous hawker center in Chinatown. Home to Tian Tian Hainanese Chicken Rice (Anthony Bourdain's pick). Over 100 stalls. Arrive early for popular stalls.

singapore-flyer.name: Singapore Flyer
singapore-flyer.notes: 165m observation wheel with panoramic Marina Bay views. 30-minute rotation. Premium experiences include champagne flights and dining capsules.

artscience-museum.name: ArtScience Museum
artscience-museum.notes: Distinctive lotus-shaped museum at Marina Bay Sands. Permanent 'Future World' digital art exhibition by teamLab. Rotating blockbuster exhibitions.

sydney-cruise-terminal.name: Overseas Passenger Terminal
sydney-cruise-terminal.notes: At Circular Quay, steps from Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Walk off ship into the heart of Sydney.

white-bay-cruise-terminal.name: White Bay Cruise Terminal
white-bay-cruise-terminal.notes: Secondary terminal 15 minutes from city. Free shuttle to CBD. Light rail access. Used when OPT is full.

sydney-opera-house.name: Sydney Opera House
sydney-opera-house.notes: UNESCO World Heritage Site and Sydney's most iconic building. Guided tours available, book ahead on cruise days. Multiple performance venues, restaurants. 5-minute walk from Circular Quay.

sydney-harbour-bridge.name: Sydney Harbour Bridge
sydney-harbour-bridge.notes: Iconic 1932 steel arch bridge. BridgeClimb experience ($150-300+) to summit for panoramic views. Free walk across pedestrian path. Pylon Lookout museum cheaper alternative.

bondi-beach.name: Bondi Beach
bondi-beach.notes: Australia's most famous beach. Surf culture, ocean pools, cafes. Bondi to Bronte coastal walk highly recommended (6km, stunning views). Bus from Circular Quay 30-40 min.

the-rocks-sydney.name: The Rocks
the-rocks-sydney.notes: Sydney's oldest neighborhood. Cobblestone lanes, historic pubs, weekend markets, colonial architecture. Walking distance from cruise terminal.

darling-harbour.name: Darling Harbour
darling-harbour.notes: Waterfront entertainment precinct. SEA LIFE Aquarium, WILD LIFE Zoo, Madame Tussauds. Restaurants, fireworks Saturday nights. Light rail and walking distance.

manly-beach.name: Manly Beach
manly-beach.notes: Laid-back beach town accessible by iconic 30-minute ferry from Circular Quay. Corso pedestrian mall, surf lessons, Shelly Beach snorkeling.

taronga-zoo.name: Taronga Zoo
taronga-zoo.notes: World-class zoo with harbor and Opera House views. 12-minute ferry from Circular Quay. Sky Safari cable car, keeper talks, native Australian animals.

opera-bar.name: Opera Bar
opera-bar.notes: Iconic outdoor bar beneath Opera House sails. Harbour Bridge views, sunset drinks. Live music. Prime position but prices to match.

icebergs-dining-room.name: Icebergs Dining Room & Bar
icebergs-dining-room.notes: Famous restaurant overlooking Bondi Beach and ocean pool. Italian cuisine. Book ahead for window seats. Below the iconic Icebergs swimming club.

royal-botanic-garden-sydney.name: Royal Botanic Garden
royal-botanic-garden-sydney.notes: 30-hectare garden in harbor foreshore. Free entry. Mrs Macquarie's Chair lookout with Opera House and Bridge views. Adjacent to Opera House.

tokyo-cruise-terminal.name: Tokyo International Cruise Terminal
tokyo-cruise-terminal.notes: New cruise terminal in Tokyo Bay. Shuttle bus connections to central Tokyo. Used by larger vessels.

osanbashi-yokohama.name: Osanbashi Pier
osanbashi-yokohama.notes: Yokohama's main cruise terminal. 10-minute walk to Chinatown. 30-minute train to central Tokyo. Stunning rooftop deck with city views.

tsukiji-outer-market.name: Tsukiji Outer Market
tsukiji-outer-market.notes: Famous food market. Freshest sushi breakfast, tamagoyaki, street food. Inner wholesale moved to Toyosu but outer market thrives. Go early.

teamlab-planets.name: teamLab Planets TOKYO
teamlab-planets.notes: Immersive digital art museum. Wade through water, walk barefoot through infinite spaces. Book tickets days ahead online. Mind-blowing experience.

shibuya-crossing.name: Shibuya Crossing
shibuya-crossing.notes: World's busiest pedestrian crossing. 3,000 people cross at once during rush hour. Starbucks and Shibuya Sky for aerial views. Hachiko statue nearby.

senso-ji-temple.name: Senso-ji Temple
senso-ji-temple.notes: Tokyo's oldest and most famous temple. Thunder Gate (Kaminarimon), Nakamise shopping street, pagoda. Free entry. Visit early morning or evening to avoid crowds.

meiji-shrine.name: Meiji Shrine
meiji-shrine.notes: Serene Shinto shrine in forested park near Harajuku. Dedicated to Emperor Meiji. 70-hectare forest feels worlds away from city. Free entry.

tokyo-skytree.name: Tokyo Skytree
tokyo-skytree.notes: World's tallest tower (634m). Two observation decks at 350m and 450m. Clear days show Mt. Fuji. Evening views spectacular. Shopping mall below.

harajuku.name: Harajuku
harajuku.notes: Tokyo's youth fashion capital. Takeshita Street for kawaii culture, cosplay shops, crepes. Adjacent to Meiji Shrine and Yoyogi Park.

akihabara.name: Akihabara
akihabara.notes: Electronics and anime mecca. Multi-story arcades, manga shops, maid cafes. Overwhelming sensory experience. Otaku paradise.

yokohama-chinatown.name: Yokohama Chinatown
yokohama-chinatown.notes: Japan's largest Chinatown with 500+ restaurants and shops. Excellent dim sum, soup dumplings. 10-minute walk from Osanbashi cruise terminal.

cup-noodles-museum.name: Cup Noodles Museum
cup-noodles-museum.notes: Interactive museum celebrating instant noodles. Make your own custom Cup Noodles. Fun for all ages. In Yokohama's Minato Mirai district.

hong-kong-cruise-terminal.name: Kai Tak Cruise Terminal
hong-kong-cruise-terminal.notes: Modern terminal on former airport runway. Free shuttle to MTR. Rooftop park with skyline views.

ocean-terminal-hk.name: Ocean Terminal
ocean-terminal-hk.notes: Prime Kowloon location at Harbour City mall. Walk off ship to shopping and Star Ferry. Used by smaller ships.

victoria-peak.name: Victoria Peak
victoria-peak.notes: Hong Kong's most famous viewpoint. Peak Tram funicular (steep ride, often long queues) or bus 15 from Central. Sky Terrace 428 highest viewing platform. Spectacular day and night.

star-ferry.name: Star Ferry
star-ferry.notes: Iconic green-and-white ferries crossing Victoria Harbour since 1888. HK$3 (cheapest sightseeing in HK). Tsim Sha Tsui to Central, 7 minutes.

tian-tan-buddha.name: Tian Tan Buddha (Big Buddha)
tian-tan-buddha.notes: 34m bronze Buddha on Lantau Island. 268 steps to summit. Ngong Ping 360 cable car (25 min, stunning views) or bus. Po Lin Monastery vegetarian lunch.

hong-kong-disneyland.name: Hong Kong Disneyland
hong-kong-disneyland.notes: Compact Disney park on Lantau Island. World of Frozen opened 2023. MTR Disneyland Resort Line from Sunny Bay.

temple-street-night-market.name: Temple Street Night Market
temple-street-night-market.notes: Kowloon's famous night market. Electronics, clothes, fortune tellers. Street food stalls. Opens around 4pm, busiest after dark. MTR: Jordan.

man-mo-temple-hk.name: Man Mo Temple
man-mo-temple-hk.notes: Atmospheric 1847 temple on Hollywood Road. Giant incense coils hanging from ceiling. Dedicated to gods of literature and war. Free entry.

tim-ho-wan.name: Tim Ho Wan
tim-ho-wan.notes: World's cheapest Michelin-starred restaurant. Famous BBQ pork buns. Multiple locations. Expect queues. Original in Sham Shui Po.

symphony-of-lights.name: Symphony of Lights
symphony-of-lights.notes: Nightly 8pm multimedia show across Victoria Harbour skyline. Best viewed from Tsim Sha Tsui promenade or Aqua Luna junk boat. Free from promenade.

ladies-market.name: Ladies' Market
ladies-market.notes: Kilometre-long market in Mong Kok. Clothing, accessories, souvenirs, electronics. Bargaining expected. Most vendors speak English. MTR: Mong Kok.

shanghai-cruise-terminal.name: Shanghai Port International Cruise Terminal
shanghai-cruise-terminal.notes: Main cruise terminal in Baoshan district. 45-60 minutes from The Bund by taxi. Ship shuttles usually available.

the-bund.name: The Bund
the-bund.notes: Shanghai's iconic waterfront with Art Deco colonial buildings and Pudong skyline views. Best at sunrise or evening when buildings light up. 1.5km promenade.

shanghai-tower.name: Shanghai Tower
shanghai-tower.notes: World's second tallest building (632m). 118th floor observation deck at 546m. Clear days see 50km. In Pudong financial district across from Bund.

yu-garden.name: Yu Garden
yu-garden.notes: 400-year-old classical Chinese garden. Pavilions, rockeries, dragon walls. Adjacent bazaar with tea houses, dumpling shops. Nine-turn bridge iconic photo spot.

french-concession.name: French Concession
french-concession.notes: Tree-lined streets with 1920s architecture, boutiques, cafes. Former French colonial area. Great for walking, vintage shopping, brunch.

nanjing-road.name: Nanjing Road
nanjing-road.notes: World's longest shopping street (5.5km). East section pedestrianized. Connects People's Square to The Bund. Neon signs, department stores, crowds.

din-tai-fung-shanghai.name: Din Tai Fung
din-tai-fung-shanghai.notes: Taiwan's famous dumpling house. Xiaolongbao (soup dumplings) are legendary. Watch chefs through glass. Multiple Shanghai locations.

propaganda-poster-art-centre.name: Propaganda Poster Art Centre
propaganda-poster-art-centre.notes: Hidden basement museum with 5,000+ original Mao-era posters. Fascinating and chilling. Tricky to find in residential building. Worth the hunt.

zhujiajiao-water-town.name: Zhujiajiao Water Town
zhujiajiao-water-town.notes: 1,700-year-old water town 40km from Shanghai. Stone bridges, canals, traditional architecture. Gondola rides, local snacks. Popular day trip.

bangkok-cruise-terminal.name: Laem Chabang Cruise Port
bangkok-cruise-terminal.notes: Thailand's main cruise port. 90km (2-3 hours) from Bangkok. Ship excursions or private transfers to city. Alternative: shuttle to Pattaya.

grand-palace-bangkok.name: Grand Palace
grand-palace-bangkok.notes: Thailand's most sacred site. Emerald Buddha, stunning architecture. Strict dress code (no shorts, shoulders covered). 500 baht entry. Go early to avoid crowds.

wat-arun.name: Wat Arun (Temple of Dawn)
wat-arun.notes: Iconic riverside temple with 70m spire. Climb for river views. Best photographed from opposite bank at sunset. 100 baht entry.

chatuchak-market.name: Chatuchak Weekend Market
chatuchak-market.notes: World's largest weekend market. 15,000+ stalls, 27 sections. Everything from antiques to pets. Saturdays and Sundays only. Go early, stay hydrated.

khao-san-road.name: Khao San Road
khao-san-road.notes: Famous backpacker hub. Street food, bars, massage parlors, souvenir stalls. Lively at night. Walking distance from Grand Palace area.

floating-markets.name: Damnoen Saduak Floating Market
floating-markets.notes: Thailand's most famous floating market. Vendors in wooden boats. Touristy but photogenic. 100km from Bangkok. Go very early (6-9am) to beat crowds.

rooftop-bar-bangkok.name: Sky Bar at Lebua
rooftop-bar-bangkok.notes: Famous from 'The Hangover II'. 63rd floor open-air bar with panoramic views. Smart dress code. Expensive cocktails but unforgettable sunset views.

jim-thompson-house.name: Jim Thompson House
jim-thompson-house.notes: Beautiful traditional Thai houses with art collection. Story of American silk entrepreneur who mysteriously vanished. Excellent guided tours.

bali-cruise-terminal.name: Benoa Cruise Terminal
bali-cruise-terminal.notes: Bali's cruise port on southern peninsula. 20 minutes to Seminyak, 90 minutes to Ubud. Ship excursions or private drivers (negotiate).

uluwatu-temple.name: Uluwatu Temple
uluwatu-temple.notes: Dramatic cliff-top temple 70m above Indian Ocean. Kecak fire dance at sunset (6pm). Watch for cheeky monkeys. Sarong required (provided).

ubud-monkey-forest.name: Sacred Monkey Forest Sanctuary
ubud-monkey-forest.notes: 700+ Balinese long-tailed macaques in mossy temple forest. Atmospheric but monkeys can be grabby. Secure belongings. 80k IDR entry.

tegallalang-rice-terraces.name: Tegallalang Rice Terraces
tegallalang-rice-terraces.notes: Instagram-famous terraced rice paddies north of Ubud. Swings, cafes, photo spots. Can be crowded. Go early morning. Small 'donations' requested.

seminyak-beach.name: Seminyak Beach
seminyak-beach.notes: Trendy beach with upscale beach clubs (Potato Head, Ku De Ta). Sunset drinks, surfing, trendy restaurants. More sophisticated than Kuta.

tanah-lot.name: Tanah Lot Temple
tanah-lot.notes: Iconic temple on ocean rock. Only accessible at low tide. Best at sunset. Very popular - arrive early. 60k IDR entry.

jimbaran-bay.name: Jimbaran Bay
jimbaran-bay.notes: Beach restaurants serving grilled seafood at sunset. Feet-in-sand dining. Choose your fish from display. Atmospheric but touristy. Near cruise port.

ubud-center.name: Ubud Town Center
ubud-center.notes: Bali's cultural heart. Art galleries, craft markets, yoga studios, organic cafes. Royal Palace, Ubud Market. 90 minutes from cruise port.

brisbane-cruise-terminal.name: Brisbane International Cruise Terminal
brisbane-cruise-terminal.notes: Modern terminal at Portside Wharf, Hamilton. Ferry and CityCat connections to CBD. Shops and restaurants at terminal.

south-bank-brisbane.name: South Bank Parklands
south-bank-brisbane.notes: Inner-city beach and parklands on Brisbane River. Streets Beach (man-made lagoon), restaurants, weekend markets. Free entry. CityCat stop.

lone-pine-koala.name: Lone Pine Koala Sanctuary
lone-pine-koala.notes: World's first and largest koala sanctuary. Cuddle a koala (extra fee, Queensland allows it), hand-feed kangaroos. 30 min by bus or scenic river cruise.

story-bridge.name: Story Bridge
story-bridge.notes: Brisbane's iconic cantilever bridge. Adventure Climb to summit (like Sydney BridgeClimb but shorter queues). Twilight climbs popular. Howard Smith Wharves below.

brisbane-cbd.name: Brisbane City Center
brisbane-cbd.notes: Compact walkable CBD. Queen Street Mall for shopping. City Botanic Gardens, Treasury Casino, Eagle Street Pier dining. Very accessible.

citycat-ferry.name: CityCat Ferry
citycat-ferry.notes: Brisbane's river ferry network. Best cheap sightseeing - ride end to end ($5.80). Connects cruise terminal to South Bank, CBD. go card for discounts.

howard-smith-wharves.name: Howard Smith Wharves
howard-smith-wharves.notes: Revitalized riverside precinct under Story Bridge. Craft breweries, restaurants, stunning views. Popular weekend spot. Walk from CBD.

auckland-cruise-terminal.name: Queens Wharf Cruise Terminal
auckland-cruise-terminal.notes: Downtown Auckland waterfront. Walk off into Viaduct Harbour and CBD. Princes Wharf has additional berths.

sky-tower-auckland.name: Sky Tower
sky-tower-auckland.notes: Auckland's iconic 328m tower. Observation decks, revolving restaurant, SkyWalk (outside ledge) and SkyJump (192m controlled fall). 15-minute walk from terminal.

waiheke-island.name: Waiheke Island
waiheke-island.notes: Wine and olive-oil paradise 35-minute ferry from Auckland. Boutique vineyards, beaches, art galleries. Bike rentals and wine tours popular.

viaduct-harbour.name: Viaduct Harbour
viaduct-harbour.notes: Upmarket marina and entertainment precinct. Restaurants, bars, superyachts. America's Cup history. Walk from cruise terminal.

auckland-art-gallery.name: Auckland Art Gallery
auckland-art-gallery.notes: New Zealand's largest art institution. Maori and Pacific art, international collection. Free general admission. Beautiful heritage and modern buildings.

mount-eden.name: Mount Eden (Maungawhau)
mount-eden.notes: Auckland's highest volcanic cone. 360-degree city views from summit. Sacred Maori site. Easy walk up, great for sunrise/sunset. Free.

bay-of-islands.name: Bay of Islands
bay-of-islands.notes: Subtropical paradise 3 hours north. 144 islands, dolphins, Hole in the Rock cruise. Waitangi Treaty Grounds (NZ founding). Popular cruise call on its own.

south-pacific-bora-bora.name: Bora Bora
south-pacific-bora-bora.notes: Legendary turquoise lagoon with Mount Otemanu backdrop. Tender port - boats shuttle to Vaitape. Lagoon tours, snorkeling with rays and sharks, jet ski.

south-pacific-moorea.name: Moorea
south-pacific-moorea.notes: Tahiti's dramatic sister island. Belvedere Lookout for volcanic peak views, pineapple fields, dolphin encounters. 30 min ferry from Papeete.

south-pacific-tahiti.name: Papeete, Tahiti
south-pacific-tahiti.notes: French Polynesia's capital and cruise hub. Black-sand beaches, Marché de Papeete market, waterfalls. Gateway to outer islands.

south-pacific-fiji.name: Fiji Islands
south-pacific-fiji.notes: 333 islands of legendary friendliness. Kava ceremonies, snorkeling, cloudbreak surfing. Cruise ports at Suva (capital) or Lautoka.

south-pacific-vanuatu.name: Vanuatu
south-pacific-vanuatu.notes: Melanesian paradise. Blue holes (swimming in stunning mineral pools), active volcanoes, traditional villages. Port Vila main cruise stop.

south-pacific-noumea.name: Nouméa, New Caledonia
south-pacific-noumea.notes: French Pacific territory. Excellent croissants, protected UNESCO lagoon, Melanesian culture. Popular from Australia cruises. Anse Vata beach.

cozumel-puerta-maya.name: Puerta Maya Cruise Terminal
cozumel-puerta-maya.notes: Large shopping and restaurant complex at pier. 2-3 miles south of downtown San Miguel. Taxis or 45-minute coastal walk to town.

cozumel-punta-langosta.name: Punta Langosta Cruise Terminal
cozumel-punta-langosta.notes: Pier right in downtown San Miguel. Walk off and you're shopping. Limited availability - check your ship's assignment.

san-miguel-cozumel.name: San Miguel Downtown
san-miguel-cozumel.notes: Main town center with shops, restaurants, and the central plaza. Mariachi music, taco stands, tequila tastings. Walkable from Punta Langosta.

palancar-reef.name: Palancar Reef
palancar-reef.notes: World-famous dive site on Mesoamerican Barrier Reef. Coral canyons, swim-throughs, turtles, rays, nurse sharks. Visibility often exceeds 100 feet.

paradise-beach-cozumel.name: Paradise Beach
paradise-beach-cozumel.notes: Great for families. Pool, water toys, jet skis. $50-80 packages include food and drinks. Shuttle from all cruise piers.

mr-sanchos.name: Mr. Sanchos Beach Club
mr-sanchos.notes: All-inclusive beach club with unlimited food and drinks. Lively party atmosphere. Pool floats, water toys. Very popular - book ahead.

nachi-cocom.name: Nachi Cocom Beach Club
nachi-cocom.notes: Limits daily guests for quieter experience. Great for couples. All-inclusive option. More relaxed than Mr. Sanchos.

el-cielo-cozumel.name: El Cielo Starfish Sandbar
el-cielo-cozumel.notes: Knee-deep turquoise lagoon with dozens of orange starfish. Look but don't touch - oils harm them. Boat tour required. Unforgettable experience.

san-gervasio.name: San Gervasio Mayan Ruins
san-gervasio.notes: Ancient Maya pilgrimage site dedicated to goddess Ixchel. Peaceful, uncrowded. Iguanas sunning on ancient stones. In island interior.

cozumel-museum.name: Cozumel Museum
cozumel-museum.notes: Excellent museum downtown covering Maya cosmology and island history. Good air-conditioned break from heat.

nassau-cruise-port.name: Prince George Wharf
nassau-cruise-port.notes: Main cruise terminal in downtown Nassau. Walk directly into Bay Street shopping. Festival Place welcome center at pier.

bay-street-nassau.name: Bay Street
bay-street-nassau.notes: Main shopping street with duty-free stores, straw market, restaurants. Walk directly from cruise pier. Colorful colonial architecture.

atlantis-paradise-island.name: Atlantis Paradise Island
atlantis-paradise-island.notes: Massive resort with waterpark, aquarium, marine habitats. Day passes available ($170+). 15-minute taxi over bridge. Worth it for families.

cabbage-beach.name: Cabbage Beach
cabbage-beach.notes: Beautiful public beach on Paradise Island. Chair rentals, vendors. Access via water taxi from Nassau or taxi over bridge.

junkanoo-beach.name: Junkanoo Beach
junkanoo-beach.notes: Closest beach to cruise port - 10 minute walk. Chair rentals, food vendors, water sports. Gets crowded on cruise days.

nassau-straw-market.name: Nassau Straw Market
nassau-straw-market.notes: Large market selling handwoven straw goods, souvenirs. Bargaining expected. Adjacent to Bay Street. Can be pushy - friendly 'no thanks' works.

queen-stairs.name: Queen's Staircase
queen-stairs.notes: 66 steps carved by slaves in 1793. Leads to Fort Fincastle with city views. Free to visit. Shaded walk from downtown.

pirates-nassau.name: Pirates of Nassau Museum
pirates-nassau.notes: Interactive museum on Golden Age of Piracy. Blackbeard, Nassau's pirate history. Good for families. $15 entry, air-conditioned.

st-thomas-havensight.name: Havensight Cruise Terminal
st-thomas-havensight.notes: Main cruise terminal with Havensight Mall. Taxi stand, duty-free shopping. 2 miles from Charlotte Amalie downtown.

crown-bay-st-thomas.name: Crown Bay Cruise Terminal
crown-bay-st-thomas.notes: Secondary cruise terminal west of Havensight. Smaller but closer to downtown Charlotte Amalie. Good shopping complex.

charlotte-amalie.name: Charlotte Amalie Downtown
charlotte-amalie.notes: Historic Danish colonial town. Duty-free shopping paradise. Main Street, Back Street, and waterfront. 99 Steps. Historic Fort Christian.

magens-bay.name: Magens Bay Beach
magens-bay.notes: Consistently ranked among world's best beaches. Heart-shaped bay with calm turquoise water. $5 entry. Chair/umbrella rentals. 20-min taxi from pier.

coki-beach.name: Coki Beach
coki-beach.notes: Best snorkeling on St. Thomas. Vibrant reef right off beach. Equipment rentals available. Gets crowded but worth it. Next to Coral World.

coral-world.name: Coral World Ocean Park
coral-world.notes: Underwater observatory and marine park. Swim with sea lions, stingray encounters. Adjacent to Coki Beach. Family-friendly.

skyride-st-thomas.name: St. Thomas Skyride (Paradise Point)
skyride-st-thomas.notes: Gondola ride to 700ft overlook. Stunning harbor views. Restaurant and bar at top. $25 roundtrip. Right at Havensight.

philipsburg-cruise-port.name: Philipsburg Cruise Port
philipsburg-cruise-port.notes: Main cruise pier on Dutch side. Walk into Philipsburg or taxi to beaches. Water taxi to town center available.

philipsburg-downtown.name: Philipsburg Downtown
philipsburg-downtown.notes: Historic Dutch capital. Front Street duty-free shopping, boardwalk, beach. Courthouse, Old Street. 15-minute walk from pier.

great-bay-beach.name: Great Bay Beach
great-bay-beach.notes: Beach along Philipsburg boardwalk. Free, convenient. Restaurants and bars nearby. Calm water. Walking distance from pier.

maho-beach.name: Maho Beach
maho-beach.notes: Famous for planes landing directly overhead (Princess Juliana Airport runway). Sunset Bar, flight schedule posted. Taxi from pier.

orient-bay.name: Orient Beach
orient-bay.notes: Famous beach on French side. Multiple beach clubs, restaurants. Part clothing-optional. 30-min taxi. Quintessential St. Martin experience.

marigot-st-martin.name: Marigot
marigot-st-martin.notes: French capital. Open-air market (Wed/Sat), waterfront dining, Fort Louis views. French bakeries and bistros. 20-min taxi.

loterie-farm.name: Loterie Farm
loterie-farm.notes: Hidden gem nature reserve with ziplines, hiking, pool bar, farm-to-table dining. Peaceful escape from beaches. On Pic Paradis.

georgetown-cruise-port.name: George Town Tender Pier
georgetown-cruise-port.notes: Tender port - ships anchor offshore. Tender to George Town waterfront. Walk into town or taxi to beaches. Can have waits on busy days.

georgetown-downtown.name: George Town Downtown
georgetown-downtown.notes: Capital of Cayman Islands. Duty-free shopping, restaurants. Walk from tender pier. Cayman Islands National Museum.

seven-mile-beach-cayman.name: Seven Mile Beach
seven-mile-beach-cayman.notes: Famous stretch of white sand. Actually 5.5 miles. Public access points, water sports, beach bars. Taxi or walk from George Town.

stingray-city.name: Stingray City
stingray-city.notes: Iconic sandbar where you wade with friendly stingrays. One of Caribbean's top experiences. Book excursion. Waist-deep water.

hell-grand-cayman.name: Hell
hell-grand-cayman.notes: Unusual black limestone formations. Small viewing platform. Send postcard from Hell Post Office. Quick stop, kitschy but fun.

cayman-turtle-centre.name: Cayman Turtle Centre
cayman-turtle-centre.notes: Marine park with sea turtles, snorkel lagoon, predator tank. Hold baby turtles. Controversial for conservation but popular.

eden-rock.name: Eden Rock
eden-rock.notes: Shore diving/snorkeling in George Town harbor. Caves, swim-throughs, tarpon, silversides. Walk from tender pier. Gear rental available.

cococay-arrival-plaza.name: CocoCay Arrival Plaza
cococay-arrival-plaza.notes: Royal Caribbean's private island in the Bahamas. Tender from ship. Complimentary beach areas plus add-on experiences.

thrill-waterpark.name: Thrill Waterpark
thrill-waterpark.notes: Tallest waterslide in North America (Daredevil's Peak). Wave pool, lazy river, kid splash. Additional fee but worth it.

chill-island.name: Chill Island
chill-island.notes: Complimentary beach area with loungers (first-come), hammocks, floating mats. Beautiful turquoise water. No extra charge.

coco-beach-club.name: Coco Beach Club
coco-beach-club.notes: Premium exclusive beach with overwater cabanas, infinity pool, butler service. Stunning Bahamas beach. Additional fee.

oasis-lagoon.name: Oasis Lagoon
oasis-lagoon.notes: Caribbean's largest freshwater pool with swim-up bar. Complimentary. Loungers around pool. Great alternative to beach.

up-up-away-balloon.name: Up, Up and Away Balloon
up-up-away-balloon.notes: Tethered helium balloon rising 450 feet for panoramic views. Additional fee. Stunning photo opportunity of island and ship.

labadee-pier.name: Labadee Pier
labadee-pier.notes: Royal Caribbean's private peninsula in Haiti. Ships dock directly (no tender). 260-acre paradise. Food and basic activities included.

labadee-dragon-coaster.name: Dragon's Breath Flight Line
labadee-dragon-coaster.notes: One of world's longest over-water ziplines. 2,600 feet from mountain to beach. Thrilling Caribbean views. Additional fee.

adrenaline-beach.name: Adrenaline Beach
adrenaline-beach.notes: Action beach with jet skis, parasailing, kayaks. Additional fees for motorized sports. Complimentary loungers and beach.

barefoot-beach.name: Barefoot Beach
barefoot-beach.notes: Quieter family beach area. Complimentary loungers, hammocks. Calmer water for swimming. Food service available.

dragon-tail-coaster.name: Dragon's Tail Coaster
dragon-tail-coaster.notes: Caribbean's first alpine coaster. Gravity-powered sled down mountain track. Control your speed. Additional fee.

labadee-artisan-market.name: Artisan Market
labadee-artisan-market.notes: Local Haitian crafts, paintings, woodwork. Bargaining expected. Supports local artisans. Near arrival area.

falmouth-cruise-port.name: Falmouth Cruise Port
falmouth-cruise-port.notes: Purpose-built cruise port with restored Georgian architecture. Walk into Historic Falmouth town. Near Dunn's River Falls.

dunns-river-falls.name: Dunn's River Falls
dunns-river-falls.notes: Iconic 600-foot waterfall you climb hand-in-hand. Jamaica's #1 attraction. 1-hour taxi from Falmouth. Book early - very popular.

mystic-mountain.name: Mystic Mountain
mystic-mountain.notes: Rainforest adventure park near Ocho Rios. Sky Explorer, Bobsled ride, zipline. Amazing views. Can combine with Dunn's River.

ocho-rios-town.name: Ocho Rios Town
ocho-rios-town.notes: Bustling town center. Island Village shopping, Craft Market, jerk centers. Main tourist hub on north coast. 1-hour taxi from Falmouth.

blue-hole-jamaica.name: Blue Hole
blue-hole-jamaica.notes: Natural swimming hole with waterfall jumping. Less crowded alternative to Dunn's River. Local guides helpful. Amazing photos.

montego-bay-hip-strip.name: Hip Strip (Gloucester Avenue)
montego-bay-hip-strip.notes: Main tourist strip in Montego Bay. Shops, restaurants, bars, Doctor's Cave Beach. Some ships dock here instead of Falmouth.

doctors-cave-beach.name: Doctor's Cave Beach
doctors-cave-beach.notes: Famous Montego Bay beach on Hip Strip. Calm turquoise water, white sand. $6 entry. Chair/umbrella rentals. Very accessible.

curacao-cruise-terminal.name: Curaçao Cruise Terminal
curacao-cruise-terminal.notes: Walk across Queen Emma Bridge (floating bridge) into Willemstad. Or short walk to Otrobanda side. Multiple berths available.

willemstad-punda.name: Punda District
willemstad-punda.notes: UNESCO World Heritage area with iconic colorful Dutch colonial buildings along Handelskade. Photography paradise. Walk from pier.

queen-emma-bridge.name: Queen Emma Pontoon Bridge
queen-emma-bridge.notes: Historic floating pedestrian bridge connecting Punda and Otrobanda. Swings open for ships. Free to walk. Iconic photo spot.

mambo-beach.name: Mambo Beach
mambo-beach.notes: Popular beach with restaurants, beach clubs, shopping. Sea Aquarium nearby. $5 entry. 15-minute taxi from pier. Lively atmosphere.

playa-kenepa.name: Playa Kenepa (Knip Beach)
playa-kenepa.notes: Postcard-perfect beach on west side. Stunning cliff backdrop, turquoise water. 45-min taxi. Worth the trip for beach lovers.

curacao-sea-aquarium.name: Curaçao Sea Aquarium
curacao-sea-aquarium.notes: Marine park with dolphin encounters, sea lion shows, touch tanks. Adjacent to Mambo Beach. Popular family excursion.

hato-caves.name: Hato Caves
hato-caves.notes: Impressive limestone caves with stalactites, bats, ancient petroglyphs. Guided tours. Air-conditioned escape. Near airport.

costa-maya-cruise-port.name: Costa Maya Cruise Port
costa-maya-cruise-port.notes: Purpose-built cruise port on Yucatan coast. Large complex with pools, restaurants, beach. Remote location but self-contained.

costa-maya-pool.name: Port Pool Complex
costa-maya-pool.notes: Complimentary pool at cruise port with swim-up bar. Loungers available. Great if you want to stay close to ship.

mahahual-beach.name: Mahahual Beach
mahahual-beach.notes: Authentic Mexican fishing village beach. Walk from port or short taxi. Beach clubs, restaurants. Less commercial than port complex.

chacchoben-ruins.name: Chacchoben Mayan Ruins
chacchoben-ruins.notes: Well-preserved Mayan ruins 1-hour inland. Less crowded than Tulum. Pyramids in jungle setting. Popular ship excursion.

banco-chinchorro.name: Banco Chinchorro
banco-chinchorro.notes: Western hemisphere's largest coral atoll. World-class diving/snorkeling. Full-day trip. Remote, pristine, unforgettable.

bacalar-lagoon.name: Laguna Bacalar
bacalar-lagoon.notes: Stunning freshwater lagoon with seven shades of blue. 2-hour drive but worth it. Swimming, kayaking, cenotes nearby.

glacier-bay-margerie.name: Margerie Glacier
glacier-bay-margerie.notes: Spectacular tidewater glacier at head of Tarr Inlet. 21 miles long, 1 mile wide. Active calving - watch for icebergs breaking off. Ships spend 1-2 hours here.

glacier-bay-johns-hopkins.name: Johns Hopkins Glacier
glacier-bay-johns-hopkins.notes: Less visited but stunning glacier. Harbor seals haul out on ice floes. Some ships visit here instead of or in addition to Margerie.

glacier-bay-lamplugh.name: Lamplugh Glacier
glacier-bay-lamplugh.notes: Known for intense blue color. Ships often pass by en route to Margerie. Stunning when sunlight hits the ice.

glacier-bay-bartlett-cove.name: Bartlett Cove
glacier-bay-bartlett-cove.notes: National Park headquarters at bay entrance. Rangers board ships here for glacier narration. Whale watching often excellent in lower bay.

glacier-bay-south-marble.name: South Marble Island
glacier-bay-south-marble.notes: Major wildlife viewing stop. Steller sea lions, puffins, cormorants, kittiwakes. Ships slow for viewing and photos.

haines-cruise-dock.name: Haines Cruise Ship Dock
haines-cruise-dock.notes: Small dock at Portage Cove, walkable to town. Some ships tender instead. Very small-town Alaska feel.

fort-seward.name: Fort William H. Seward
fort-seward.notes: Historic 1904 Army post, now National Historic Landmark. Arts community, galleries, Alaska Indian Arts totem carvers. Walk from dock.

haines-downtown.name: Downtown Haines
haines-downtown.notes: Authentic small Alaska town. Sheldon Museum, local shops, Fogcutter Bar. Walking distance from dock. Very uncrowded compared to other ports.

chilkat-bald-eagles.name: Chilkat Bald Eagle Preserve
chilkat-bald-eagles.notes: World's largest concentration of bald eagles (3,000+ in fall salmon run). 48,000-acre preserve along Chilkat River. Float trips and bus tours available.

rainbow-glacier.name: Rainbow Glacier
rainbow-glacier.notes: Accessible via flightseeing or multi-hour tour. Less crowded glacier experience than Juneau. Stunning views of Chilkat Range.

icy-strait-point-dock.name: Icy Strait Point Dock
icy-strait-point-dock.notes: Purpose-built cruise facility at historic Hoonah cannery. Tlingit-owned and operated. Gondola to mountaintop. Very authentic Alaska Native experience.

ziprider.name: ZipRider
ziprider.notes: World's largest zipline - 5,330 feet long, 1,300 feet vertical drop, speeds to 60mph. Stunning views of Icy Strait. Book ahead, sells out.

icy-strait-whale-watching.name: Point Adolphus Whale Watching
icy-strait-whale-watching.notes: One of Alaska's best whale watching spots. Humpbacks feed here summer months. High success rate for sightings. Multiple tour operators.

hoonah-tribal-house.name: Huna Tribal House
hoonah-tribal-house.notes: Traditional Tlingit clan house. Cultural demonstrations, dance performances. Authentic connection to Huna Tlingit heritage.

icy-strait-cannery.name: Historic Cannery Museum
icy-strait-cannery.notes: Restored 1912 salmon cannery. Museum exhibits, shopping, restaurants. Heart of the cruise facility. Free to explore.

seward-cruise-dock.name: Seward Cruise Ship Dock
seward-cruise-dock.notes: Small harbor dock, often embarkation/disembarkation point for Alaska cruises. Connected to Anchorage by Alaska Railroad (4 hours scenic).

alaska-sealife-center.name: Alaska SeaLife Center
alaska-sealife-center.notes: Marine research aquarium with Steller sea lions, seals, puffins, octopus. Walk from cruise dock. Excellent rainy day option.

kenai-fjords-np.name: Kenai Fjords National Park
kenai-fjords-np.notes: Stunning fjord cruises to see tidewater glaciers, whales, sea lions, puffins. Half or full day boat trips. Exit Glacier accessible by road.

exit-glacier.name: Exit Glacier
exit-glacier.notes: Only road-accessible glacier in Kenai Fjords. Easy trail to glacier face, harder trail to Harding Icefield overlook. 12 miles from Seward.

resurrection-bay.name: Resurrection Bay
resurrection-bay.notes: Protected bay with sea otters, seals, eagles, often whales. Shorter cruise option than Kenai Fjords for limited time.

seward-downtown.name: Downtown Seward
seward-downtown.notes: Historic small town with shops, restaurants, galleries. Iditarod trailhead. Walking distance from dock. Very scenic waterfront.

sitka-cruise-dock.name: Sitka Cruise Ship Lightering Dock
sitka-cruise-dock.notes: Tender port - ships anchor in Sitka Sound. Tenders to O'Connell Lightering Facility or Crescent Harbor. Downtown very walkable from both.

st-michaels-cathedral.name: St. Michael's Cathedral
st-michaels-cathedral.notes: Iconic Russian Orthodox cathedral (rebuilt after 1966 fire). Original 1848 icons saved. Heart of Sitka's Russian heritage. Small entry fee.

sitka-national-historical-park.name: Sitka National Historical Park
sitka-national-historical-park.notes: Site of 1804 Tlingit-Russian battle. Totem pole trail through rainforest. Southeast Alaska Indian Cultural Center. Free admission.

alaska-raptor-center.name: Alaska Raptor Center
alaska-raptor-center.notes: Rehabilitation center for injured bald eagles and raptors. Flight demonstrations, up-close eagle encounters. Very popular shore excursion.

fortress-bears.name: Fortress of the Bear
fortress-bears.notes: Sanctuary for orphaned brown bears. Up-close viewing from elevated platforms. Not wild bears but excellent for photos and education.

sitka-downtown.name: Downtown Sitka
sitka-downtown.notes: Historic downtown with Russian Bishop's House, Sheldon Jackson Museum. Unique blend of Tlingit, Russian, and American history. Very walkable.

skagway-cruise-dock.name: Skagway Cruise Ship Docks
skagway-cruise-dock.notes: Multiple docks at town's edge. Walk directly into historic downtown Broadway. Can be 4+ ships on busy days.

skagway-broadway.name: Broadway Street
skagway-broadway.notes: Restored 1898 gold rush main street. Boardwalks, false-front buildings, saloons. Klondike Gold Rush NHP visitor center. Walk from any dock.

white-pass-railroad.name: White Pass & Yukon Route Railroad
white-pass-railroad.notes: Iconic narrow-gauge railroad built during gold rush. Climbs 3,000 ft in 20 miles. Multiple trip options to White Pass Summit or Fraser, BC. Book ahead.

chilkoot-trail.name: Chilkoot Trail
chilkoot-trail.notes: Historic gold rush trail to Klondike. Dyea trailhead 9 miles from Skagway. Multi-day hike or day trip to lower portions. Ranger programs available.

red-onion-saloon.name: Red Onion Saloon
red-onion-saloon.notes: 1898 saloon and former brothel. Duck Fart shots, good food. Brothel museum upstairs ($10). Gold rush atmosphere.

klondike-gold-rush-nhp.name: Klondike Gold Rush NHP Visitor Center
klondike-gold-rush-nhp.notes: National Park Service visitor center on Broadway. Free exhibits, ranger talks, films about 1898 gold rush. Starting point for historic walking tour.

tracy-arm-sawyer.name: Sawyer Glaciers
tracy-arm-sawyer.notes: Twin tidewater glaciers at head of Tracy Arm. Active calving, massive ice walls. Ships spend 2-3 hours at glaciers. Seals on ice floes.

tracy-arm-fjord.name: Tracy Arm Fjord
tracy-arm-fjord.notes: 30-mile fjord with 3,000ft granite walls. Waterfalls, wildlife, floating icebergs. Scenic cruising takes several hours each way.

endicott-arm.name: Endicott Arm
endicott-arm.notes: Parallel fjord to Tracy Arm, sometimes used as alternate when ice blocks Tracy. Dawes Glacier at head. Less trafficked, equally beautiful.

fords-terror.name: Fords Terror
fords-terror.notes: Remote wilderness inlet off Endicott Arm. Named for 1889 naval crew's terrifying experience with currents. Small boats only.

honolulu-cruise-terminal.name: Honolulu Cruise Terminal
honolulu-cruise-terminal.notes: Ships dock at Aloha Tower Marketplace area. Historic Aloha Tower landmark. Downtown Honolulu location.

pearl-harbor.name: Pearl Harbor National Memorial
pearl-harbor.notes: Must-visit WWII site. USS Arizona Memorial free (timed tickets required). Plan 4+ hours for full experience. Book ahead!

waikiki-beach.name: Waikiki Beach
waikiki-beach.notes: Iconic Hawaiian beach with Diamond Head backdrop. Great for swimming, surfing lessons. Busy but beautiful. Easy bus from port.

diamond-head.name: Diamond Head Crater
diamond-head.notes: Iconic volcanic crater hike. 1.6-mile roundtrip to summit. 560ft elevation gain. Requires reservations. Stunning views.

honolulu-downtown.name: Downtown Honolulu
honolulu-downtown.notes: Iolani Palace (only royal palace in US), state capitol, Chinatown. Walking distance from cruise port.

ala-moana.name: Ala Moana Center
ala-moana.notes: World's largest open-air shopping center. Good bus connection from port. Beach park adjacent.

maui-cruise-dock.name: Kahului Harbor
maui-cruise-dock.notes: Main Maui cruise port at Kahului. Some smaller ships use Lahaina. Industrial area - attractions require transport.

haleakala.name: Haleakala National Park
haleakala.notes: 10,023ft volcanic crater. Sunrise requires reservations. Ship excursions available. 2+ hour drive from port. Bring warm layers!

lahaina-town.name: Lahaina Historic Town
lahaina-town.notes: Historic whaling town. Note: August 2023 wildfire caused significant damage. Check current status before visiting.

road-to-hana.name: Road to Hana
road-to-hana.notes: Famous 64-mile scenic drive with 600+ curves. Full day trip. Waterfalls, black sand beaches. Not recommended for cruise day unless extended port time.

maui-beaches.name: Maui Beaches
maui-beaches.notes: Kaanapali and Wailea are top beach areas. Requires taxi or shuttle from Kahului port. Beach resorts allow day access.

iao-valley.name: Iao Valley State Park
iao-valley.notes: Lush valley with iconic Iao Needle. Short drive from Kahului port. Easy walks, beautiful scenery. Good half-day option.

hilo-cruise-dock.name: Hilo Cruise Dock
hilo-cruise-dock.notes: Ships dock at Pier 1 near downtown Hilo. Walking distance to farmers market, historic buildings, waterfalls.

hawaii-volcanoes-np.name: Hawaii Volcanoes National Park
hawaii-volcanoes-np.notes: Active volcano! See Kilauea crater, steam vents, lava tubes. 45-minute drive from Hilo. Full day recommended. Book ship excursion or rent car.

rainbow-falls.name: Rainbow Falls
rainbow-falls.notes: Beautiful 80ft waterfall. Free! 2 miles from cruise port. Best morning for rainbows. Easy viewing platform.

hilo-downtown.name: Historic Downtown Hilo
hilo-downtown.notes: Charming historic downtown. Famous farmers market (Wed & Sat). Walking distance from port. Authentic Hawaiian town feel.

akaka-falls.name: Akaka Falls State Park
akaka-falls.notes: Stunning 442ft waterfall. 30-minute drive north of Hilo. Easy loop trail through rainforest. Often combined with scenic drive.

kona-cruise-dock.name: Kona Tender Port
kona-cruise-dock.notes: Tender port - ships anchor offshore. Tenders to Kailua Pier. Historic Kona town is walkable from pier. Weather can affect operations.

kona-historic.name: Historic Kailua-Kona
kona-historic.notes: Charming historic waterfront town. Alii Drive shops and restaurants. Hulihe'e Palace, Mokuaikaua Church. All walkable from tender pier.

kona-coffee.name: Kona Coffee Country
kona-coffee.notes: World-famous Kona coffee region. Many farms offer tours and tastings. 15-30 minute drive south. Ship excursions available.

kona-snorkeling.name: Kona Coast Snorkeling
kona-snorkeling.notes: Exceptional snorkeling at Kealakekua Bay and other sites. Boat tours to Captain Cook Monument. Marine sanctuary with abundant sea life.

kona-beach.name: Kona Beaches
kona-beach.notes: Several beaches near Kona. Kahalu'u Beach Park good for snorkeling. Magic Sands popular but small. Most require short drive.

nawiliwili-cruise-dock.name: Nawiliwili Harbor
nawiliwili-cruise-dock.notes: Kauai's cruise port at Nawiliwili Harbor. Near Lihue. Anchor Bay area. Car rental or tours needed for attractions.

waimea-canyon.name: Waimea Canyon
waimea-canyon.notes: Spectacular 14-mile canyon, 3,600ft deep. Multiple lookouts. 1.5-hour drive from port. Often combined with Kokee State Park.

na-pali-coast.name: Na Pali Coast
na-pali-coast.notes: Iconic dramatic cliffs. Accessible by boat tour, helicopter, or Kalalau Trail. Some cruise ships sail past. Unforgettable scenery.

poipu-beach.name: Poipu Beach
poipu-beach.notes: Kauai's sunniest beach area. Great swimming, snorkeling. Monk seals often on beach. 30-minute drive from port.

wailua-river.name: Wailua River & Fern Grotto
wailua-river.notes: Hawaii's only navigable river. Boat tours to Fern Grotto. Kayak rentals available. 15 minutes from port.

seattle-cruise-terminal.name: Seattle Cruise Terminals
seattle-cruise-terminal.notes: Main terminals at Pier 91 (Smith Cove) and Pier 66 (Bell Street). Both accessible to downtown. Alaska cruise gateway.

pike-place-market.name: Pike Place Market
pike-place-market.notes: Iconic 1907 public market. Fish throwing, fresh produce, crafts, restaurants. Don't miss the gum wall and original Starbucks.

space-needle.name: Space Needle & Seattle Center
space-needle.notes: Iconic 605ft observation tower. Seattle Center includes MoPOP, Chihuly Garden. Book ahead for Space Needle. Monorail connects to downtown.

pioneer-square.name: Pioneer Square
pioneer-square.notes: Seattle's original downtown. Historic architecture, Underground Tour, galleries. Good restaurants and nightlife.

seattle-waterfront.name: Seattle Waterfront
seattle-waterfront.notes: Revitalized waterfront with Seattle Aquarium, Great Wheel, restaurants. Connects Pike Place to Pioneer Square.

la-cruise-terminal.name: World Cruise Center
la-cruise-terminal.notes: Main LA cruise port in San Pedro. Also Long Beach terminal. 25 miles from LAX. Gateway to Mexican Riviera cruises.

santa-monica.name: Santa Monica Pier & Beach
santa-monica.notes: Iconic pier with Pacific Park amusement rides. End of Route 66. Beautiful beach. 30+ miles from cruise port - plan accordingly.

hollywood.name: Hollywood
hollywood.notes: Walk of Fame, TCL Chinese Theatre, Hollywood sign views. Tourist-heavy but iconic. 25+ miles from cruise port.

la-downtown.name: Downtown Los Angeles
la-downtown.notes: Revitalized downtown with Grand Central Market, Walt Disney Concert Hall, arts district. 20 miles from cruise port.

san-pedro-fishermans.name: San Pedro Waterfront
san-pedro-fishermans.notes: Adjacent to cruise terminal. Waterfront shops, restaurants, Battleship USS Iowa museum. Walkable from port.

san-diego-cruise-terminal.name: San Diego Cruise Terminal
san-diego-cruise-terminal.notes: Downtown waterfront location at B Street or Broadway Pier. Walking distance to Gaslamp, USS Midway, and Seaport Village.

gaslamp-quarter.name: Gaslamp Quarter
gaslamp-quarter.notes: Historic 16-block entertainment district. Victorian architecture, restaurants, nightlife. 10-minute walk from cruise port.

uss-midway.name: USS Midway Museum
uss-midway.notes: Historic aircraft carrier museum. 60+ aircraft, flight simulators. Adjacent to cruise terminal. Allow 2-3 hours.

balboa-park.name: Balboa Park
balboa-park.notes: 1,200-acre urban park with San Diego Zoo, 17 museums, gardens. Zoo alone needs full day. Short drive or Uber from port.

coronado.name: Coronado Island
coronado.notes: Beautiful beach community with iconic Hotel del Coronado. Ferry from downtown (near cruise port) or drive across bridge.

galveston-cruise-terminal.name: Galveston Cruise Terminals
galveston-cruise-terminal.notes: Texas's busiest cruise port. Two terminals. Gateway to Caribbean and Western Caribbean cruises. 50 miles from Houston.

galveston-strand.name: The Strand Historic District
galveston-strand.notes: Victorian-era downtown with shops, restaurants, architecture. Walking distance from cruise port. Mardi Gras headquarters.

galveston-seawall.name: Seawall & Beach
galveston-seawall.notes: 10-mile seawall with beach access. Restaurants, attractions along boulevard. Pleasure Pier amusement park.

moody-gardens.name: Moody Gardens
moody-gardens.notes: Three glass pyramids with aquarium, rainforest, discovery museum. Also has beach, golf, hotel. 15 minutes from cruise port.

galveston-pleasure-pier.name: Pleasure Pier
galveston-pleasure-pier.notes: Amusement pier on the seawall. Rides, games, food. Family-friendly. On historic site of Flagship Hotel.

new-orleans-cruise-terminal.name: Port of New Orleans
new-orleans-cruise-terminal.notes: Two terminals along Mississippi River. Walking distance to French Quarter. Streetcar accessible. Major Caribbean gateway.

french-quarter.name: French Quarter
french-quarter.notes: Historic heart of New Orleans. Bourbon Street, Jackson Square, St. Louis Cathedral, beignets at Cafe Du Monde. 15-minute walk from port.

jackson-square.name: Jackson Square
jackson-square.notes: Heart of the French Quarter. St. Louis Cathedral, street performers, artists. Iconic New Orleans photo spot.

garden-district.name: Garden District
garden-district.notes: Beautiful historic neighborhood with antebellum mansions. Take St. Charles streetcar. Magazine Street shopping.

nola-wwii-museum.name: National WWII Museum
nola-wwii-museum.notes: World-class WWII museum. Multiple pavilions, immersive exhibits. Plan 4+ hours. Walking distance from cruise port.

burj-khalifa.name: Burj Khalifa
burj-khalifa.notes: World's tallest building at 828m. Observation decks on floors 124-125 and 148. Book At the Top tickets in advance.

dubai-mall.name: Dubai Mall
dubai-mall.notes: World's largest mall by total area. Features Dubai Aquarium, ice rink, virtual reality park. Adjacent to Burj Khalifa.

dubai-fountain.name: Dubai Fountain
dubai-fountain.notes: World's largest choreographed fountain. Free shows every 30 minutes from 6pm-11pm. Burj Khalifa Lake location.

gold-souk-dubai.name: Gold Souk
gold-souk-dubai.notes: Traditional gold market with hundreds of retailers. 10+ tons of gold on display. Negotiating expected.

old-dubai-creek.name: Dubai Creek & Al Fahidi
old-dubai-creek.notes: Historic heart of Dubai. Traditional abra boats (1 AED), wind-tower houses, Dubai Museum in Al Fahidi Fort.

palm-jumeirah.name: Palm Jumeirah
palm-jumeirah.notes: Iconic palm-shaped artificial island. Atlantis resort at the crescent. Monorail access. Beach clubs and restaurants.

jumeirah-beach.name: Jumeirah Beach
jumeirah-beach.notes: Public beach with views of Burj Al Arab. JBR Walk promenade with shops and restaurants.

burj-al-arab.name: Burj Al Arab
burj-al-arab.notes: Iconic sail-shaped luxury hotel. Restaurant or afternoon tea reservations required for access.

dubai-marina.name: Dubai Marina
dubai-marina.notes: Waterfront district with tallest residential towers. Marina Walk promenade, yacht harbor, dining options.

sheikh-zayed-mosque.name: Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque
sheikh-zayed-mosque.notes: One of world's largest mosques. 82 domes, 1,000+ columns. Free tours available. Modest dress required.

louvre-abu-dhabi.name: Louvre Abu Dhabi
louvre-abu-dhabi.notes: Universal museum on Saadiyat Island. Jean Nouvel's iconic dome. Masterpieces from around the world.

ferrari-world.name: Ferrari World Abu Dhabi
ferrari-world.notes: World's largest indoor theme park. Formula Rossa - world's fastest roller coaster. Yas Island location.

yas-marina-circuit.name: Yas Marina Circuit
yas-marina-circuit.notes: Formula 1 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix circuit. Driving experiences available. Adjacent to Ferrari World.

corniche-abu-dhabi.name: Corniche Beach & Promenade
corniche-abu-dhabi.notes: 8km waterfront promenade. Blue Flag beaches, cycling paths, parks. Heritage Village nearby.

emirates-palace.name: Emirates Palace
emirates-palace.notes: Opulent palace hotel. Gold-flaked cappuccino. Open for dining and afternoon tea.

qasr-al-watan.name: Qasr Al Watan
qasr-al-watan.notes: Working presidential palace open to public. Arabian architecture, library, exhibitions. Adjacent to Emirates Palace.

yas-waterworld.name: Yas Waterworld
yas-waterworld.notes: World-class waterpark on Yas Island. 40+ rides and slides. Adjacent to Ferrari World.

carlisle-bay.name: Carlisle Bay
carlisle-bay.notes: Calm bay with shipwreck snorkeling. Sea turtles common. Short taxi from port. Beach chairs available.

harrisons-cave.name: Harrison's Cave
harrisons-cave.notes: Crystallized limestone cave. Electric tram tours through underground streams and formations.

mount-gay-rum.name: Mount Gay Rum Distillery
mount-gay-rum.notes: World's oldest rum distillery (1703). Tour and tasting experiences. Near Spring Garden Highway.

bridgetown-historic.name: Historic Bridgetown
bridgetown-historic.notes: UNESCO World Heritage Site. Parliament Buildings, Nidhe Israel Synagogue. Walk from cruise port.

bathsheba-beach.name: Bathsheba Beach
bathsheba-beach.notes: Dramatic Atlantic coast. Famous Soup Bowl surf break. Rock formations. 45 min drive from port.

st-nicholas-abbey.name: St. Nicholas Abbey
st-nicholas-abbey.notes: 1658 Jacobean plantation house. Sugar heritage, rum distillery, gardens. One of three remaining in Western Hemisphere.

crane-beach.name: Crane Beach
crane-beach.notes: Pink-tinged sand beach. Cliff access. Bodysurfing waves. Historic Crane hotel overhead.

pitons.name: The Pitons
pitons.notes: UNESCO World Heritage volcanic spires. Gros Piton is climbable (3-4 hours). Iconic Caribbean landmark.

sulphur-springs.name: Sulphur Springs
sulphur-springs.notes: World's only drive-in volcano. Bubbling sulphur pools, therapeutic mud baths nearby.

marigot-bay.name: Marigot Bay
marigot-bay.notes: Protected palm-fringed bay. Yacht harbor, waterfront restaurants. One of Caribbean's most beautiful anchorages.

pigeon-island.name: Pigeon Island National Landmark
pigeon-island.notes: Historic military site connected by causeway. Fort Rodney ruins, hiking trails, beaches. Jazz festival venue.

diamond-falls.name: Diamond Falls Botanical Gardens
diamond-falls.notes: Mineral-stained waterfall changes colors. Historic mineral baths from 1784. Near Soufrière.

soufriere-town.name: Soufrière
soufriere-town.notes: Historic French colonial town beneath the Pitons. Waterfront, local restaurants, gateway to volcanic sites.

reduit-beach.name: Reduit Beach
reduit-beach.notes: Main tourist beach at Rodney Bay. Calm waters, beach bars, water sports. 45 min from Castries port.

anse-chastanet.name: Anse Chastanet
anse-chastanet.notes: Best snorkeling in St. Lucia. Marine reserve. Resort beach open to day visitors. Near Soufrière.
